DataElement.preferredName: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the ovarian and primary peritoneal carcinoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to clinical evaluated M stage of an ovarian tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the ovaries, the female reproductive glands in which the ova (eggs) are formed. The ovaries are located in the pelvis, one on each side of the uterus.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the ovaries, the female reproductive glands in which the ova (eggs) are formed. The ovaries are located in the pelvis, one on each side of the uterus.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC:American Joint Committee on Cancer Cancer Staging Manual, 6th Ed., 2002

ValueDomain.preferredName: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma cM0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma cM0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma cM0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma cM1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma cM1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma with distant metastasis (excludes peritoneal metastasis). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma cM1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma with distant metastasis (excludes peritoneal metastasis). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma Clinical Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
